definition: to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: Attainable-Realistic means uninspiring and status quo.
sentences.chinese: 现实性意味着没那么刺激与安于现状。

sentences.english: They never seem content with their present situation.
sentences.chinese: 他们似乎从不安于现状。

sentences.english: But Gemini bosses are never satisfied with the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 但双子座的上司从不安于现状。

definition: satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
lit. as a monk for today, toll today's bell (idiom)/fig. to do one's job mechanically/to hold a position passively
pinyin: zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: to make progress/to do better/fig. ambitious to improve oneself/to move forwards
